dublin_core.dcvalue: That distribution of specialists in neurological sciences worldwide is lopsided is an accepted fact That increasing the number of specialists providing them with the requisite infrastructure and maintaining high standards to provide neurological and neurosurgical surgical care worldwide is just not possible is also accepted Patients from suburban areas are sent to the limited number of tertiary neurosciences referral centers incurring expense and time and resulting in overwork at these centers It is easier to set up an excellent telecommunication infrastructure to increase the reach of the limited number of urban specialists than to put them in suburban areas
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:31:01Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2005-03-07
Studies in health technology and informatics
